Try it

cURL

Python

JavaScript

PHP

Go

Java

Copy

```
curl --request POST \
  --url https://app.chatwoot.com/api/v1/accounts/{account_id}/webhooks \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'api_access_token: <api-key>' \
  --data '{
  "url": "https://example.com/webhook",
  "subscriptions": [\
    "conversation_created",\
    "conversation_status_changed"\
  ]
}'
```

#### Authorizations

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/webhooks/add-a-webhook#authorization-api-access-token)

api\_access\_token

string

header

required

This token can be obtained by visiting the profile page or via rails console. Provides access to endpoints based on the user permissions levels. This token can be saved by an external system when user is created via API, to perform activities on behalf of the user.

#### Path Parameters

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/webhooks/add-a-webhook#parameter-account-id)

account\_id

integer

required

The numeric ID of the account

#### Body

application/json

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/webhooks/add-a-webhook#body-url)

url

string

The url where the events should be sent

Example:

`"https://example.com/webhook"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/webhooks/add-a-webhook#body-subscriptions)

subscriptions

enum<string>\[\]

The events you want to subscribe to.

Show child attributes

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/webhooks/add-a-webhook#parameter-element)

enum<string>

Available options:

`conversation_created`,

`conversation_status_changed`,

`conversation_updated`,

`message_created`,

`message_updated`,

`contact_created`,

`contact_updated`,

`webwidget_triggered`

Example:

```
[\
  "conversation_created",\
  "conversation_status_changed"\
]
```

The list of subscribed events

number

The id of the account which the webhook object belongs to
